snippet: Lawyers for two of the three Broncos suspended for violating the N.F.L.’s drug policy said they were likely to ask a state court to overturn the punishments.
abstract: Lawyers for Ryan McBean and D J Williams, two of three Denver Broncos suspended for violating the NFL’s drug policy, are likely to file a lawsuit in state court in Colorado in an attempt to overturn the rulings; players contend that the league-appointed drug test collector mishandled their urine samples and that the arbitrator who heard their appeals violated protocol in several ways, including speaking to an NFL executive in private.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for two of the three Broncos suspended for violating the N.F.L.’s drug policy said they were likely to ask a state court to overturn the punishments.

headline.seo: Suspended Broncos McBean and Williams Might File Lawsuit
headline.main: Suspended Broncos May File a Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Suspended Broncos May File A Lawsuit
